page.title: 02PRESTBURY VILLAGE
page.content: { PRESTBURY}IS A VILLAGE SITED ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF CHELTENHAM ON THE MAIN ROAD TOWARDS WINCHCOMBE.{THE HEART}OF THE VILLAGE IS BUILT AROUND THE{HIGH {STREET AND THE BURGAGE.}THERE ARE A GREAT NUMBER OF OLD BUILDINGS DATING BACK TO THE 15th CENTURY. THE CHURCH OF ST. MARY'S IS{NORMAN}IN FOUNDATION. THE VILLAGE IS A{POPULAR AREA}IN WHICH TO LIVE, BEING AN ATTRACTIVE PLACE AND BEING CLOSE TO THE COTSWOLD HILLS. ALTHOUGH CHELTENHAM HAS ENCROACHED UPON PRESTBURY AND THERE IS NO OPEN SPACE BETWEEN THE TWO, THE VILLAGERS DO NOT REGARD THEMSELVES AS BEING A PART OF THE TOWN. LIFE IN THE VILLAGE IS RELATIVELY {SELF-CONTAINED,}BUT THE RESIDENTS RELY ON ACTIVITIES TAKING PLACE IN AND AROUND TOWN, SOME OF WHICH, SUCH AS THE CHELTENHAM RACE MEETINGS, AFFECT THE VILLAGE CONSIDERABLY.
